intro: Lysimachia collina, commonly known as white mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Lysimachia collina is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
